Akers Biosciences, Inc. (NASDAQ: AKER) (AIM: AKR.L), ("Akers Bio" or the "Company"), a developer of rapid health information technologies, announces the pricing of an underwritten public offering with expected total gross proceeds of approximately $6,000,000, before deducting underwriting discounts, commissions and other offering expenses payable by the Company (the "Offering").

The securities offered by the Company consist of (i) Class A Units consisting of 15,500,000 shares of Common Stock and Warrants to purchase 15,500,000 shares of Common Stock, at a public offering price of $0.15 per Class A Unit, and (ii) Class B Units consisting of 3,675 shares of our Series B Convertible Preferred Stock, with a stated value of $1,000, and convertible into an aggregate of 24,500,000 shares of Common Stock, and Warrants to purchase 24,500,000 shares of Common Stock, at public offering price of $1,000 per Class B Unit. All the Warrants will have an exercise price of $0.1875, will be exercisable upon issuance and will expire five years from the date of issuance. The Company has granted the underwriters a 45-day option to purchase additional shares of Common Stock and additional Warrants to purchase shares of Common Stock, in amounts up to 15% of the Common Stock, Warrants, and Common Stock issuable upon conversion of the Series B Preferred included in the Class B Units sold in the Offering.

11:26 am
BE11:26am

We remain attracted to the long term growth potential of Primark; however, we think its rating may continue to be compromised by a lack of LFL sales progress for existing stores. We have reduced our ABF EPS forecasts by 2-3% owing to lower LFL sales forecasts and lower Sugar profitability and we are now slightly below consensus. Our PT moves from £35 to £31.

DJ what's going on with TWTR? apparently heavy call buying past few sessions..
BE11:26am

Primark a best in class discounter but some concerns. Primark remains one of the stronger apparel retailers around in our view with several competitive advantages, eg compelling price point, a structurally low gross margin, increased fashionability and strong management including at store level. However, we think its high volume densities may be becoming a constraint to LFL sales growth, it lacks a transactional online offer and we think it will take a long time for it to reach critical mass in the US, where it lacks brand recognition.

BE11:27am

Reducing EPS forecasts 2-3%, now slightly below consensus. For ABF we have reduced our FY18/19E EPS forecasts by 2-3%.

For main business Primark we have lowered our EBIT forecasts by 3%, owing to lower LFL sales assumptions (now flat for FY18E versus +1.5% previously and +1% for FY19E versus +2% previously). We have also lowered our FY19E EBIT margin forecast slightly owing to expectations of more price competition in the sector.

Our Sugar EBIT forecasts fall by 6-9% for FY18-19E owing to a lower recent trend in world sugar prices and as we assume a £8-10mn reduction from the closure of Vivergo’s UK biofuel plant, which is the UK’s largest and Europe’s second biggest producer of ethanol.

Forecasts for other divisions are broadly unchanged, in fact have risen slightly for FY19E given a recent slightly weaker than expected sterling trend on continued Brexit uncertainty. Our revised EPS FY18-19 forecasts are 1-3% below the latest Bloomberg forecasts.

red thing about twitter is although it finds it difficult to make money, its service ie twitter feed is capable of making billions everyday for others. so it stays relevant. unlike snap.
BE11:34am

We are upgrading TWTR shares to Overweight with a $27 price target & it is one of our top smid-cap ideas in 2018. We believe both the TWTR story & financial results will strengthen over the next year as the company continues to build on its differentiated value proposition for users & returns to revenue growth. Our upgrade is based on 4 key points: 1) TWTR products are improving led by video & live streaming content, changes across the timeline, notifications, & Explore tab, & a better UI; 2) We expect continued double-digit DAU growth of 10% in 2018; 3) We believe TWTR can grow ad revenue in 4Q17 excluding year-ago headwinds from TellApart/NFL/elections, and grow ad revenue 8.6% in 2018 on increasing demand; & 4) TWTR should be GAAP profitable in 2018, even after increasing investments, as it benefits from revenue-driven margin expansion. We are increasing our 2018/2019 revenue 3.2% 4.7% & EBITDA 6.9% 10.7%. We recognize that TWTR shares are up 30% since 3Q earnings in late October & are not cheap at 11.8x 2019E EBITDA on our revised numbers. But we believe increasing traction with both users & advertisers will drive upside to 2018 consensus (we are 4% above on revenue & 15% on EBITDA) & investor sentiment around TWTR remains mixed. Our $27 PT is based on 15x 2019E EBITDA of $1.125B.

FATDAZ @boncouer I have lots of those happy to share if you want to point me in the right direction

BE11:37am

To battle revenue and user base deceleration, Twitter has
been in the midst of a reinvention as the company revamps its product, rolls out video, increases content, improves analytics, and reorganizes its sales force. We believe that now is the time to jump in as user growth and engagement traffic have stabilized and even started growing. We see 2018 as an opportunity for revenue pick-up given easier comps. We initiate with a BUY on Twitter and $26 price target based on 6.6x EV to 2018 sales of $2.5B, a multiple that is only a slight premium to its peer median of 6x. We understand that the stock has had periods of underperformance but believe the market may not be giving enough credit to TWTR’s performance trends and turnaround and believe its relatively modest valuation provides sufficient reward/risk profile for coming in early on this speculative investment.

Sancho MU? as in Micron
BE11:40am

Only thing I have on the Horizonte Minerals Vermelho nickel-cobalt project thing is FinnCap, which is shop.

BE11:41am

Horizonte has announced that it has agreed to acquire a 100% interest in the Vermelho nickel-cobalt project in Brazil from Vale for a total cost of US$8.0m, the great majority of which is in the form of deferred payments. In addition, the company has announced a conditional placing to raise up to £8.5m at 3.5p per share. We retain our medium-term target price of 8p.

FATDAZ @boncouer DBK piece in usual place for you
11:41 am
BE11:41am

The Vermelho nickel project is located c85 km from the northern part of Horizonte’s Araguaia project located south of the Carajás mining district the state of Pará, Brazil. The Vermelho project was developed by Vale with the objective of becoming its principal nickel-cobalt operation. Extensive work was undertaken on the project which included drilling programmes totalling 152,000 metres, full scale pilot test work and detailed engineering studies. The project was subsequently taken through a feasibility programme with Vale announcing a positive development decision in 2005.

Boncoeur @fatdaz: got it, smashing! God bless you.
BE11:41am

The project was designed around the construction of a high pressure acid leaching plant (HPAL) to process the nickel/cobalt laterite ore. The Feasibility Study included a five-year metallurgical test work and pilot plant programme which delivered 96% average leaching extraction rates of nickel and cobalt, in addition LME grade nickel – cathode was produced. The Feasibility Study showed production capacity of 46,000 tons/annum (tpa) of metallic nickel, and 2,500 tpa of metallic cobalt, with an expected commercial life of 40 years.

BE11:42am

Vermelho was subsequently placed on hold after Vale acquired Inco in late 2006, this acquisition provided Vale with a nickel division and provided the basis for Vale becoming the world’s largest nickel producer today

FATDAZ MY pleasure :)

And Petrofac

11:43 am
Petrofac Ltd (PFC:LSE): Last: 474.10, up 8.2 (+1.76%), High: 480.90, Low: 463.10, Volume: 1.53m
Soundbuy Aye, JM at HZM pulled off equally impressive acquistion from GLEN a while back.......
BE11:44am

Mild positive on the completion of the first contract migration in Mexico.

BE11:44am

Morgan Stanley incoming.

11:44 am
BE11:45am

Petrofac announced it had migrated he Santuario Production
Enhancement Contract (PEC) into an interest in a Production Sharing Contract (PSC). Under the new contract, Petrofac will own 36% equity interest and will be operator while Pemex E&P will hold the remaining 64%. The PSC will run for 25 years with two 5-year extensions. The migration of the contract we think is the first step toward unlocking value from these assets. The company highlighted the net book value of the PEC was $260m, and as a result of the migration expects to incur a small impairment charge. In our price target we assume 50% of NPV for the key IES assets, including Santuario. The other assets pending migration include Magallanes and Arenque, both smaller than Santuario on an NPV basis.

BE11:45am

And Goldman.

BE11:45am

Petrofac had mentioned earlier in the year that whilst timing was uncertain it was working on the migration of Mexican assets to PSCs. We note that over 2017, Petrofac has invested limited capex into its Mexican assets. Through the migration of the Santuario asset, capex may increase slightly but we would still expect 2018 capex to remain broadly in line with management guidance provided at the time of the 2017 pre-close trading update of US$100-150mn.
The small impairment charge may be taken as a small negative.
Finally, noting that Petrofac has said it is looking to reduce exposure to the IES reporting segment (which includes the Mexican assets), we think it unlikely that Petrofac could divest the Mexican assets straight away if it wished to do so, as we assume the contractual terms would require the company to commit some investment into those assets; however, in the context of of its intention to reduce exposure, and while we believe a full divestment would be unlikely, we believe Petrofac could potentially consider the sale of a minority stake.

BE11:51am

UBS likes Compass.

11:51 am
Compass Group PLC (CPG:LSE): Last: 1,555, up 14 (+0.91%), High: 1,571, Low: 1,542, Volume: 1.78m
BE11:52am

While we have admired the operational and financial performance of the company we have not found valuation opportunities attractive enough to have a more positive view. We think the recent pull back provides such an opportunity and upgrade our rating to Buy from Neutral. We think what makes Compass the best in class in contract catering is (1) An entrepreneurial decentralised approach to managing the business, (2) The experience of the senior and middle management teams, (3) Economies of procurement (4) Segmentation of markets and focus and (5) A quality earnings compounder.

BE11:52am

New management changes nothing, is the gist.

11:52 am
BE11:52am

We highlight financial optionality for the shares namely (1) The potential for the US corporate tax rate to reduce which potentiality has a positive impact given over 60% of profits are generated in N America (2) Potential value enhancing M&A although we factor in share buybacks into our forecasts (3) Potential for stronger performance in Europe and RoW divisions (4) Pound devaluation with a positive translation impact. We see the opportunity for the company to return over £3bn over our forecast period through share buybacks and over £3bn through ordinary dividends (In aggregate a 25% return of the current market capitalisation).

BE11:53am

CPG trades at a significant premium to peers (On EV/EBITDA) although recently this premium has narrowed. We think consistent compounders are never "cheap" but the recent reduction in share price (in our view due to currency movements, conservative margin guidance, limited ability for buybacks in near term and perhaps concerns of a CPG without Richard Cousins) provides sufficient upside for us to rate the shares Buy (from Neutral). We continue to value on c21x (22 implied as roll forward for a 12 month PT) 2018e PE which provides our new £17 PT (previous £16.55, but rolled forward for 12 months) and see scope for future buybacks with a 12month view.

undefined

11:58 am
BE11:58am

We argue that the stock's gains for the iPhone X supercycle are in the late innings. We believe unit growth, if not quite ASP growth, is well anticipated by consensus and a historically full multiple. While its user base and services growth are powerful tailwinds, neither is yet sufficient to flout the trend of 30-40% intracycle downticks. We consider now the time to downgrade; supply/demand balance for the X portends component anxiety.

red EM 2018. Crude. Maybe. S&P500 no surprises here.
BE12:00pm

So, we have Nomura tracking shipment times as a proxy of Iphone X volumes. Just one day slippage on the shipping is apparently pointing to 79m units sold, which is consensus, but with little chance of upside.

BE12:00pm

U.S. telcos initially intimated X demand would push into F2Q and cushion Apple’s typical ~25% seasonal declines. Balanced supply/demand signals the below-seasonal declines in our (and consensus) estimates are less likely. Apple's famously noisy supply chain often sees cancellations as early as December.

Boncoeur @red: did you see Opec saying shale supply growth will eclipse demand growth.
12:00 pm
BE12:01pm

And, yeah, it remains a single product company.

BE12:01pm

We caution the high margin services business, while growing quickly, remains ~15% of sales and is a derivative of unit sales. We are thus unwilling to ascribe a robust standalone multiple. Lower corporate tax rates will help others more than Apple; we are not convinced repatriation will be a significant boon. Both may be priced in.

BE12:01pm

We trim our FY18E units from 265mn to 245mn (consensus 242mn). A higher ASP cushions our EPS decline; we trim our FY18E from $11.75 to $11.50. Our $175 target is 15x our CY18E EPS of $11.67 and 14x our CY19E EPS of $12.40.

red im going with the techs Boncoeur on crude but that is one of a few reasons why its a maybe.
